Your role will be part of a growing team focused on supporting the Enterprise Data Organization (EDO) Operations team within PepsiCo. You will directly support the EDO Operations Lead with managing the EDO resourcing/staffing plans, budget considerations, and Annual Operating Plans. You will work closely and collaborate with the Enterprise Data Organization team to ensure monthly actuals and forecast resources and cost are maintained and implement new processes to streamline how the team operates. Ability to work and understand finance and global procurement processes to efficiently process SOWs /WO’s, POs, Invoices, etc.

Conduct thorough analysis of the Enterprise Data Organization financials, identify, and flag any gaps or issues identified

Track and manage all Enterprise Data Organization contractors and ensure all updates are captured in the central resource management tool, OneRoster and internal EDO Trackers
Support monthly financial reviews with Finance and Enterprise Data Organization leadership team
Serve as the contact for Enterprise Data Organization with Finance Business Partners

Boeing Global Services (BGS) is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Plano, TX.

This role will help business leaders to make smarter talent decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies to create reporting solutions, dashboards, and automate metrics across the digital strategy and experience (eCommerce) functions.

The ability to turn manual data processing into automated processing is critical. In addition, you will partner with internal customers, asking the right questions to understand requirement details and ensure accurate reporting. Success within this role hinges on the establishing strong working relationships with stakeholders, understanding existing data, and developing solutions that will enhance visibility of key performance indicators (KPIs).

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms. They will also have a strong business intuition and clear expertise in analyses; the ability to describe analytic processes including when and why specific approaches are favored.

Leads in designing complex Business Intelligence information models, dashboards, metrics and reports utilizing standard technologies and methodologies that meet business objectives
Assesses current technology for best fit

Distills large datasets into effective visualizations for executive reporting through data-analytics/visualization applications and languages (SQL, Python/R, and Tableau)

Leads data exploration within datasets to develop metrics supporting leadership decision making
Partners with multi-functional stakeholders across the business (analytics, information technology, execution, customer success and finance) to help define requirements, extract and compile data, develop optimized performance reporting, and drive business insight
Discovers new opportunities and solutions for problems by looking beyond current practices and using innovative thinking
Defines, designs, plans and manages projects
Controls and delivers project deliverables, project accounting and appraisal, and optimizes the contribution of the people involved
Works independently as well as collaboratively with team members to complete requirements from stakeholders

5+ years of experience in ETL (extract-transform-load)
5+ years of experience building intuitive and useful data visualizations that drive business decisions

Excellent interpersonal, written, and presentation skills, high-impact communication style

Strong knowledge of the financial industry.
Strong project management skills.
Strong communication (written and verbal) and customer interaction skills.
Excellent attention to details.

Job Title: Business Insight Analyst III (Remote based in US)
Job Description:
As a part of the Tenet and Catholic Health Initiatives family, Conifer Health brings 30 years of healthcare industry expertise to clients in more than 135 local regions nationwide. We help our clients strengthen their financial and clinical performance, serve their communities and succeed at the business of healthcare. Conifer Health helps organizations transition from volume to value-based care, enhance the consumer and patient healthcare experience and improve quality, cost and access to healthcare. Are you ready to be part of our solutions? Welcome to the company that gives you the resources and incentives to redefine healthcare services, with a competitive benefits package and leadership to take your career to the next step!

JOB SUMMARY

This position will focus on the development and delivery of business performance reports that aid operational business units to make objective decisions. The Business Insight Analyst III will assist the operational business units by performing data analysis and identifying trends that will allow the business unit to analyze and improve business performance. This position will also be responsible for the consistency and integrity of data reported. This position works with all levels of management to determine reporting requirements. Communicates improvement opportunities or analysis directly to business unit leaders by drawing observations and making astute recommendations to address strategy. May have oversight of Analyst I and/or II.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Others may be assigned.

Delivers timely and accurate scheduled (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly) reporting. Summarize disparate data to formulate analysis to client.
Independently clarifies report needs with clients to understand the purpose and content of request, utilizes systems to create and deliver analysis to meet clients’ needs, audits and analyzes data to verify quality and data integrity. Points out and researches data anomalies.
Develops and delivers complex ad hoc reports and business unit specific information. Provide suggestions and recommendations to perform the necessary analytics to ensure requests are complete and accurate.
Learns new technologies and systems to advance knowledge of reporting and analysis
Serves as a resource to Analyst I and II and provides information and training as required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Abilities:

Ability to work in a fast paced and deadline driven environment.
Advanced problem solving, conceptual and organizational skills.
Strong analytical skills, data presentation/visualization and technical capabilities that allow summarization and interpretation of data to formulate for presentation to clients
Detail oriented, meticulous, and accurate in completing tasks on time.
Strives for continuous improvement through training, self-paced and group settings, & other learning opportunities.
Excellent communication, customer service and time-management skills.
Exhibits leadership, coaching, and mentoring skills to provide strategic and analytical guidance to team members.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with other team members and customers. Respectful of all levels.
Ability to anticipate customer needs and guide clients in structuring needed reports.
Make recommendations based on analysis and interpretation of data.
Ability to develop and maintain documentation.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and in situations with minimal requirements provided.
Willing to help co-workers when needed and positively responds to cross training.
Ability to adapt to various Patient Accounting systems.
Advise and partner with clients on strategy alignment and best practices.
Position requires basic business skills, an understanding of general financial operations and major AR goals, preferably in the healthcare environment.
Advance knowledge of relational database management systems such as AS/400, Showcase, MS Access, MS SQL Server/MySQL.
Advanced SQL language skills (creating complex queries and stored procedures)
Proficient (high skill level) with various desktop applications such as Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and/or Access.
VBA, Tableau, Power BI, MicroStrategy or similar experience required.

Conifer requires its candidates, as applicable and as permitted by law, to obtain and provide confirmation of all required vaccinations and screenings prior to the start of employment. This may include, but is not limited to, the COVID-19 vaccination, influenza vaccination, and/or any future required vaccines and screenings.

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

Include minimum education, technical training, and/or experience required to perform the job.

4-year college degree in Business, Accounting, IS, Engineering and 5-7 years analytics and reporting experience.
Healthcare experience is a plus

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must be able to work in sitting position and use computer and answer telephone
Ability to travel
Includes ability to walk through hospital-based departments across broad campus settings, including Emergency Department environments

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Office Work Environment
Hospital Work Environment

Compensation

Pay: $60,528.00-$96,720.00 annually. Compensation depends on location, qualifications, and experience.
Management level positions may be eligible for sign-on and relocation bonuses.

Benefits

Medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and business travel insurance
Paid time off (vacation & sick leave) – min of 12 days per year, accrued accrue at a rate of approximately 1.84 hours per 40 hours worked.
401k with up to 6% employer match

Alkami is a leading cloud-based digital banking solutions provider for financial institutions in the United States that helps clients to transform through retail and business banking, digital account opening and loan origination, payment fraud prevention, and data analytics and engagement solutions.

Founded in 2009, we continue to be recognized for our intentional culture and tremendous growth (Best Place to Work in Fintech; Best & Brightest to Work For Nationally; and Comparably’s Best Company Culture, Best Career Growth, Best Engineering Team, and Best Places to Work in Dallas, among others). Through our bold investments in technology and people, we empower our clients to grow confidently, adapt quickly, and build thriving digital banking communities through tailored experiences for over 16.2M users.

As a remote-first company, this position can sit in Plano, TX or remote in the US.

Position Overview:

Alkami is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team, reporting directly to Strategic Operations in the Technology organization. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in driving data-driven decision-making and visibility of the metrics across the technology organization, which will drive transparency and accountability. You will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting large data sets to extract valuable insights that contribute to drive technology group efficiencies from platform, people and processes. Your expertise in data analysis and reporting will be instrumental in shaping our technology strategies and optimizing our systems and processes.

Key Responsibilities & Duties:

Collect, organize, and analyze complex datasets using various tools and techniques.
Transform business challenges into data-driven solutions that are directly linked to their impact on the organization.
Identify patterns, trends, and correlations in data to uncover actionable insights.
Thoroughly document all data request prerequisites and proposals, encompassing proof-of-concepts and comprehensive plans for data collection rollout.
Identify patterns, trends, and correlations in data to uncover actionable insights.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance to ensure accuracy and reliability of analysis.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner, translating complex data into actionable business recommendations.
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and present data-driven insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and design effective data visualizations that support business objectives.
Implement data visualization best practices to enhance data storytelling and facilitate decision-making at all levels.
Work closely with the Technology department to understand their data needs and provide analytical support for strategic initiatives.
Identify opportunities to leverage data and analytics to improve systems, processes, and workflows.
Collaborate with stakeholders at all levels to understand business requirements, priorities, and challenges.
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical team members to ensure alignment and successful execution of projects.
Participate in cross-functional initiatives, promoting a culture of data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative discipline) or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a technology-driven environment.
Demonstrates a profound grasp of business acumen, skillfully bridging data insights with the strategic objectives of the Technology organization in the long term.
Proficiency in data analysis and data visualization tools such as Google Sheets/App Scripts, Looker, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Experience working with large datasets and databases, including data extraction and transformation
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with complex data.
Ability to effectively communicate complex findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong project management and organizational skills.

Desired Skills:

Master's degree desired.
Experience with predictive modeling is a plus.

Title: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Client: Bell

Duration: fulltime/contract

Job Description:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.

Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid parental leave
Vision insurance

8 hour shift

Overview:
The Logistics Analyst is responsible for ensuring The Container Store’s import and domestic vendor shipments are managed efficiently, in a cost-effective manner, while maintaining service levels and planned deadlines. This position will accomplish this by gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data and offer actionable recommendations to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance overall logistics performance. This position works closely with the Buying, Planning, DC Operations, Accounting, and third-party transportation providers (3PLs) and will directly impact the success and competitiveness of our company.

What We Stand For
Established in 1978, The Container Store has grown to be the leading specialty retailer of storage and organization products in the United States and the only national retailer solely devoted to the category. We provide creative, multifunctional, customizable storage and organization solutions that help our customers save time, save space and improve the quality of their lives. We foster a culture built around our Foundation Principles, which define how we approach our relationships with our employees, vendors, customers and communities and influence every aspect of our business.
Responsibilities:
Oversees daily communication and coordination with import and domestic vendors and 3PLs for status updates, accurate documentation needs, service changes, and resolves potential risks
Collects and analyzes data related to logistics, including transportation costs, and supplier performance to gain performance and cost insights and drive solutions
Generates routine and ad-hoc reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) in logistics and develops dashboards and reports that provide a clear view of logistics performance metrics
Collaborates with cross-functional teams, such as Buyer and Distribution Center teams, to identify areas of improvement in the supply chain and proposes and implements changes based on data-driven insights to enhance logistics efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Analyzes and negotiates transportation rates and provides quotes to internal teams; audits and approves logistics related expenses
Partners with Buying and Distribution Center teams on hot shipments and campaign orders which includes freight prioritization and status tracking updates
Escalates the resolution of missed ship windows and any delays that may occur between vendors and The Container Store Distribution Centers.
Maintains understanding of various business divisions within The Container Store and their strategic goals. Stays updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to ensure that the company remains at the forefront of logistics analytics and operational capabilities
The Benefits of Working Here
Our benefits exemplify our commitment to ensuring employees and their families are well taken care of, safe and secure. Some of our benefits include:
Competitive Pay
Medical/Dental/Vision Plans
Discount: 50% on Elfa, 40% on Merchandise and Gift Cards, 25% on Avera
Paid Time Off plus Holidays
401(k) plan with Company Match
Employee First Fund: providing grants to employees experiencing unforeseen emergencies
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in logistics is preferred.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in logistics or supply chain
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)
Ability to work well independently, as well as effectively contribute to a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills, a faculty for numerical detail and the ability to manage complexity
Able to direct multiple projects and anticipate challenges
Must be comfortable adapting regulatory trends and statutes and adjusting processes and requirements as necessary
Experience with expediting and improvement initiatives
Familiar with Customs entry and CTPAT processes
Based in Dallas/Ft. Worth area on a hybrid schedule
Must be at least 18 years of age
The Container Store promotes a smoke-free, drug-free environment.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act

About WideOrbit:

Say hello to a Wider World. WideOrbit helps media companies do more business by making it easier to buy and sell advertising. We build the one software platform that ties everything together – TV, radio, and digital ad sales, from pitch to payment. Chances are if there's an ad on your local TV or radio station, over-the-air or streaming, our technology helped put it there. Our customers include NBCUniversal, ABC/Disney, Fox, Paramount, AMC, TelevisaUnivision, Meredith, Audacy, and many more industry leaders around the world. In February 2023, WideOrbit became a part of Lumine Group, a Canadian listed company which in turn is a part of the Constellation Software Inc. (CSI) ecosystem, a multi-billion dollar global public company.

At WideOrbit, we make preserving our inclusive environment an ongoing priority, empowering team members to contribute at every level, in every function. We hire high-energy innovators who value diversity, unafraid to wield their passion and expertise to advocate for our customers and each other. At WideOrbit, you'll make a difference and see your impact every day, while learning, growing, and enjoying what you do!


Job Description:

As a Sr. Business Analyst for the WO Payment Suite, you will empower our customers' finance teams to enhance cash flow performance, reduce DSO and accelerate collections by designing, refining, and optimizing the accounts receivable workflows of media companies. Additionally, you will collaborate with our customers' agencies to enhance their workflows as part of our broader process improvement initiatives.

To be successful in this role, you'll leverage your expertise in fintech, foster partnerships, and work collectively with customers, as well as our Product and Development Teams. Jointly, you'll solve customer business challenges through activities such as defining requirements, guiding software enhancements, influencing development directions, and meticulously documenting customers' specific issues.

If you thrive on taking a consultative approach with customers, are enthusiastic about contributing to a rapidly expanding product line, and pride yourself on your exceptional organizational and attention-to-detail skills, then this opportunity may be the perfect fit for you.




Here is what success will look like:

Be the product champion and build effective relationships with key stakeholders
Partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Development teams to build a product which users love, and drive revenue for the business
Demonstrate proficiency in the product you are presenting and provide a thorough discussion of its functionality
Continuously keep the Sales team informed about the ongoing developments in the Payments Suite product and conduct product demonstrations for potential customers
Effectively handle support cases initiated by customers to address issues promptly and leverage the insights gained from these cases to enhance and advance the WO Payments Suite product
Assist in the pricing assessment for payment processor services offered to customers using designated software
Effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously and unassisted, adeptly managing changes in scope and/or timelines to ensure alignment with both client and product deadlines
Actively engage in meetings by providing thoughtful ideas to upcoming projects and contributing to the overall success of the product
Engage in consultative discussions with customers, leveraging your critical thinking skills and subject matter expertise to understand their obstacles related to WO Payments Suite software functionality
Collect and meticulously document customer requirements for new or modified features from diverse sources and conduct market research to assess current software demands and subsequently, define features that effectively address these needs
Communicate roadblocks and problems before customer satisfaction is negatively impacted
Exhibit leadership, professionalism and preparedness when communicating with team members, as well as internal and external customers
Develop positive working relationships within other departments in the organization to meet product goals and team expectations
Coordinate with Tech Writers to ensure documentation is accurate and comprehensible
Stay current with the latest developments and emerging trends in the fintech industry, exploring opportunities to apply them to our platform in ways that can significantly benefit our clients



To thrive in this role, we're looking for:

5+ years of experience in finance-focused business operations and analysis, within the media industry is advantageous
Experience and knowledge in finance, particularly in the context of payment processing and the operational intricacies of finance teams within medium-sized and large media companies, such as Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable (AP), or Credit and Collections (C&C), is highly valuable
Proven ability to work successfully as part of a team while also assuming individual obligations
Possess exceptional written communication and product demonstration skills, along with the capability to effectively translate customer requirements into professional user story documents
Exhibit a professional demeanor, communicating in a thoughtful and consultative way with internal and external customers
Proven ability to direct and manage multiple projects while staying organized and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent sense of judgment and decision-making skills
Familiarity with product management and the software lifecycle, encompassing the knowledge of the steps involved in transitioning a product from its initial design phase to successful launch



Location:

This position can be based in any of our offices. Telecommute will also be considered.

Pay Range:

$ 90,000 - $ 140,000

The compensation range listed, and general description of other compensation and benefits will apply to this position. Various factors are considered to determine compensation ranges including market data, location, experience, qualifications, and skills. A competitive salary, health insurance, sabbatical leaves, great vacation package, work/life balance, life event benefits, casual work attire, stocked café, 401(k) match, and plenty of opportunities to grow!

Description:

The Financial Analyst Supports financial decision-making information by collecting, analyzing, investigating, and reporting financial data. Improves operational efficiencies by recommending process improvements and quality controls.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist is the preparation of monthly, quarterly and annual financial and regulatory reports.
Provide financial analysis, forecasting, reporting, variance analysis, cost-benefit analysis, and other decision support services to executive management.
Develop forecasting and reporting templates based on historical performance and future expectations.
Coordinate with management to ensure solutions, products, and programs are operational and performing as designed and forecasted
Track, compare and report on actual business results against the targeted projections incorporated in the Balance Score Card.
Track and report investments to the CFO
Produce investment and liquidity forecasting reports.
Assist in preparation of annual budget including balance sheet, income statement, Cash flows, depreciation and amortization forecasts
Prepare monthly branch production and internal financial performance reports.
Implement and maintain existing interest rate risk simulation model and related balance sheet valuation verifying the accuracy, reasonableness, and consistency of data and assumptions.
Provide forward looking assessments of interest risk under various balance sheet scenarios, supporting the optimization of the balance sheet risk-return profile.
Support ALM related initiatives, including work with external third parties involved in the ALM process as applicable to ensure accurate and timely results.
Develop a cost model to evaluate both cost and benefit associated with current and future products and services and include recommend product / service modification, improvement or elimination.
Prepare monthly and quarterly sales incentive payout spreadsheets.
Provide reporting and analysis to departments as needed.
Produce investment and liquidity forecasting reports.
Assists management in the implementation of new financial programs and procedures.
Provide recommendations on process improvements and quality controls.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
3 years to 5 years of similar or related experience (1+ years data analysis, data model evaluation, reporting design and support / 2+ years of operational working experience in a credit union, bank, or other financial service is preferred)

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Thorough understanding of Commercial Credit Analysis, including UCA Cash Flow
Complete knowledge of Commercial Lending requirements, documentation and closing procedures
Knowledge of SBA loan products and loan approval processes
Ability to work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Possess a broad knowledge of functional, organizational, and transactional processes and practices in financial services industries
Ability to create presentations that articulate business problems and present coherent solutions for leadership
Ability to compile and analyze data, formulate recommendations and present action plans
Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively interact with personnel at all levels of the company
Self-starter with ability to work effectively and independently with limited supervision in a fast paced team oriented environment.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT

Stationary work, often requiring standing or sitting for prolonged periods
Operate standard office equipment and keyboards
Visually recognize, reconcile, and verify numerical details for accuracy
Repeating motions that may include the wrists, hands and/or fingers
Must be able to access and navigate facility with reasonable accommodations
Lift and carry small parcels, packages and other items

Candidates being considered for employment with Resource One must successfully complete a credit check, background check and drug screen.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry’s technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Physical Requirements : General Office Demands

We are looking for a Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in helping business stakeholders identify and solve business problems, improve processes, and make informed decisions. The role requires strong analytical and SQL skills with the ability to combine data from disparate systems to build out scalable solutions. They will be a part of a centralized group that supports the entire organization . This role places an emphasis on building for scale, process automation, insight generation, data visualization, data management, and planning.

The ideal candidate for this role is an experienced Data Analyst with the ability to interface with business stakeholders, strong requirements gathering, SQL expertise, data analysis and visualization experience. This person must demonstrate experience building and maintaining enterprise level reporting and code. This person is a doer that views problems as opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders, including business users, IT teams, and data professionals, to understand and document business needs, objectives, and data requirements.
Create clear and comprehensive documentation of business requirements, data models, processes, and solutions in both current and future state.
Write complex SQL queries to extract and analyze data from databases.
Conduct in-depth data analysis using relevant tools to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that inform business decisions.
Create and maintain interactive and informative reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization tools (i.e. Looker, ThoughtSpot, Tableau).
Present findings, recommendations, and project updates to stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.
Develop test cases and perform user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure that solutions meet business requirements.
Act as a liaison between technical and non-technical teams to ensure alignment with business objectives.
Provide training and support to team members on data tools and interpretation.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies relevant to the role of a Data Analyst.

Must Have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Progressive experience (3+ years) working as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Progressive experience (3+ years) working in modern BI tools (i.e. Looker, ThoughtSpot, Tableau).
Progressive experience (3+ years) in writing complex SQL.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills to interact effectively with clients and team members.
Ability to think strategically and build for scalability.
Self-motivated, passionate and driven.
Superb verbal and written communication skills.

Nice to Have:

4-6 years of related experience, preferable in a SaaS environment.
Experience in Revops, R&D, Finance, or Go To Market teams.
Experience working with data from SalesForce, Segment, NetSuite, Workday and other common business tools.
Data analysis proficiency in Python.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. Summary:

As a Senior Analyst, Data Governance Operations you will play a pivotal role in driving our data governance initiatives forward. Leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will lead meaningful conversations, host trainings, and foster relationships with various teams across the organization. This role offers the chance to work closely with a diverse set of stakeholders, influencing the way data is viewed, managed, and leveraged across the organization. If you're passionate about data and its potential to drive business success, this could be the perfect role for you.

Responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders across different functions to understand and address data-related needs and challenges.
Serve as a key point of contact for data stewards and owners across different domains, assisting with onboarding, addressing queries, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed to effectively manage their domains.
Develop and nurture relationships with various teams, positioning the data governance unit as a reliable partner in all data matters.
Assist in the development and updating of training content and materials; host and facilitate training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding and implementation of data governance practices.
Support ongoing data governance projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with the company's strategic goals.
Assist in maintaining governance documentation, ensuring all processes, policies, and standards are up-to-date and easily accessible for internal teams.
Address data governance related issues, escalating where necessary and ensuring timely resolution.
Support the collection and reporting of data governance metrics, helping to showcase the progress and impact of governance initiatives.

Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Systems, Business Administration) or equivalent experience.


Required qualifications:
Minimum one year of experience supporting data governance operations, data policy, data management, or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to facilitate meetings and training sessions effectively.
Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

Principal Data Analyst

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.


As a Data Analyst at Capital One you will leverage analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.


On any given day you will be challenged on three types of work – Innovation, Business Intelligence and Data Management:


Innovation

Use Open Source/Digital technologies to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data sources and platforms

Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks for data consumers

Demonstrate ability to explore and quickly grasp new technologies to progress varied initiatives


Business Intelligence

Partner with the business to provide consultancy and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization

Drive analysis that provides meaningful insights on business strategies


Data Management

Drive an understanding and adherence to the principles of data quality management including metadata, lineage, and business definitions

Work collaboratively with appropriate Tech teams to manage security mechanisms and data access governance

Build and execute tools to monitor and report on data quality


Our ideal candidate will have:

Degree specialized in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline

Scripting experience in (Python, R, Spark, and SQL)

Strong desire and experience with data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data)

Experience utilizing and developing within AWS services


Basic Qualifications:

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s Degree plus at least 5 years of experience in data analytics, or currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Master’s Degree plus at least 3 years in data analytics, or currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD with an expectation that required degree will be obtained on or before the scheduled start date.

At least 3 years of experience in at least one scripting language

At least 1 year of experience utilizing a business intelligence visualization tool

At least 3 years of experience in querying and analyzing and working with data languages and platforms


Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics discipline

At least 4 years of experience coding in Python, R, Spark, or SQL

At least 4 years of experience working within process management and improvement methodologies – Agile, Lean, Six Sigma, etc.

At least 2 years of experience utilizing and developing within AWS services

At least 2 years of experience delivering Data Governance and Data Quality Management concepts and practices within the financial services industry

What’s Under the Hood
Bridgecrest, one of the country’s leading financial servicing providers, services roughly $15 billion in finance receivables for DriveTime and other third parties. We service auto loans across a wide credit spectrum with the intent of creating a strong path to vehicle ownership for our customers.
Bridgecrest recently launched its newest affiliate GoFi. Established in 2022, GoFi is headquartered in Dallas, Texas with a mission to deliver a comprehensive, fully integrated auto finance product allowing the best brands to deliver the best customer experience. By implementing state of the art technology, we provide an off-the-shelf service to make integration with GoFi as seamless as possible.
That’s Nice, But What’s the Job?
This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship now or in the future are not eligible for hire at this time.
In short the Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics will leverage intelligent test design and analysis of large datasets to craft pricing strategies that accomplish our organizational initiatives of growth, and profitability in an emerging branch of the company
In long the Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics is responsible for:
Designing, implementing and monitoring market pricing tests to understand the impact of price on capture rates.
Have a direct hand in creating the initial policies & programs for new product launches, including creating a monitoring suite to assess the success of the launch
Creating in-depth analyses, collaborate with stakeholders, and leverage resources skillfully to capitalize on those new opportunities.
Demonstrating strong communication skills in making recommendations to senior executives across DriveTime’s family of companies.
Constructing in-depth quantitative analysis by processing, manipulating, and studying large datasets by leveraging strong coding skills in languages such as Python, SQL, Snowflake, and R.
Being self-driven and able to take initiative to further the success of the business.
So What Kind of Folks Are We Looking for?
Killer analytical and story-telling abilities. You’ll need the capability to analyze data and in return, prepare a well-crafted narrative on your findings in the form of presentations and monitoring reports.
Intellectual curiosity & humility. Why? What? How? Do you find yourself always wanting to learn more and broaden your knowledge base in a team-oriented environment? If so, this could be the role for you.
Passionate and goal oriented. We are looking for someone that is enthusiastic about their work and is passionate about not only meeting their goals but exceeding them.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
The Specifics
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as economics, finance, statistics, engineering, computer information systems or other STEM field.
1+ years of experience in data, financial, and/or strategic analytics;
Experience with pricing test design & analysis of price elasticity a plus
Experience using analysis to create value-added strategies and make recommendations to the business to improve organizational performance
Exceptional problem-solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail.
Experience with coding languages such as Python, SQL, Snowflake, and/or R skills.
Demonstrated skill and extended extensive experience with developing quantitative analysis in Excel
Experience in creating actional reporting through Tableau or PowerBI.
So What About the Perks? Perks matter
Medical, dental, and vision, oh my! DriveTime Family of Brands covers a sizable amount of insurance premiums to ensure our employees receive top-tier healthcare coverage.
But Wait, There’s More. 401(K), Company paid life insurance policy, short and long-term disability coverage to name a few.
Growth Opportunities. You grow, I grow, we all grow! But seriously, DriveTime Family of Brands is committed to providing its employees with every opportunity to grow professionally with roughly over 1,000 employees promoted year over year.
Tuition Reimbursement. We’re as passionate about your professional development as you are. With that, we’ll put our money where our mouth is.
Wellness Program. Health is wealth! This program includes self-guided coaching and journeys, cash incentives and discounts on your medical premiums through engaging in fun activities!
Gratitude is Green. We offer competitive pay across the organization, because, well… money matters!
In-House Gym. We want our employees to be the best versions of themselves. So come early, take a break in your day or finish strong with a workout!
Give Us a Reason (or not), and We’ll Celebrate. Regardless of whether there is a holiday or not, we are finding ways to kick back and enjoy each other’s company outside of day-to-day work.
Smart-Casual Dress. Come dressed in jeans (you’ll fit right in with the rest of us).
Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays. Not just lip service: we work hard, to play hard.
Anything Else? Absolutely.
DriveTime Family of Brands is Great Place to Work Certified! And get this: 90% of our rockstar employees say they feel right at home here. We could spend a lot of time having you read about ALL our awards, but we’ll save time (and practice some humility) just naming a few others; Comparably Awards: Best Company for Diversity, Best Company Culture and Best Company Leadership, oh and don’t forget Phoenix Business Journal Healthiest Employers (okay, we’ll stop there)!

And when it comes to hiring, we don't just look for the right person for the job, we seek out the right person for DriveTime. Buckle up for plenty of opportunities to grow in a professional, fun, and high-energy environment!

The Data Governance Strategy organization within Citi’s Enterprise Chief Data Office (ECDO) is responsible for defining the Enterprise data governance strategy and liaising with groups across the Chief Data Offices, Chief Administrative Office, Technology, Enterprise Architecture, and 2nd/3rd Lines of Defense to articulate the strategy, define metrics & processes to measure progress, and ensure consistent and cohesive messaging to stakeholders, including the Business, Board and Regulators. Experience creating executive presentations (Power Point)

Strong conceptual and strategic analysis skills

Job Title: Wholesale Client Profitability - Data Analytics Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Join the Wholesale Client Profitability (WCP) Data Architect group that focuses on validation of data quality in our data warehouse. They will achieve this by owning tools and processes tied to our major controls around input review, output review, and reconciliation. Furthermore, by implementing and maintaining checks and processes where necessary such as data validations, adjustments, or reconciliations.

As a Wholesale Client Profitability - Data Analytics Associate you must possess good organization and communication skills to independently deliver on multiple assignments at once. Analytical thinking and curiosity of underlying processes are the key qualities that would impact the candidates success in the role.

Job responsibilities

Ensure data quality of WCP Production environment at all stages through execution of runbook procedures and ad hoc investigation
Solve for operational deficiencies by developing systemic or operational solutions
Partner with WCP Change Management and WCP Technology teams to transform the environment and implement new processes
Maintain proper control documentation for procedures in line with Firmwide Evergreen standards
Manage relations, communicating and presenting to various levels of stakeholders
Escalate issues as needed to the appropriate team(s) and management

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

Bachelor's degree in finance, computer science, information technology, mathematics, accounting, or related discipline
3+ years of financial services experience
Demonstrated experience with Data Warehouse systems including use of SQL
Ability to analyze and investigate complex data sets to find underlying drivers
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (particularly Excel)
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present information at varying levels of detail in a concise manner
Ability to work independently in a fast-moving environment

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

Accounting reconciliation experience is a plus
Prior experience with Alteryx, Tableau and/or Python is a plus

Company Overview
Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. The company ignites the passions of global sports fans and maximizes the presence and reach for hundreds of sports partners globally by offering innovative products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans, a global partner network with over 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, teams, players associations, athletes, celebrities, colleges, and college conferences, and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail business stores.
As a market leader with more than 18,000 employees, and hundreds of partners, suppliers, and vendors worldwide, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work, and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

Who we are:

Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com .


You Are:

UST is looking for a Senior Business Analyst who has experience in SAP IM inventory management & SAP MM procurement background, covers direct and Indirect procurement, and has the ability to read ABAP and debug.


The Opportunity :

Hybrid-In office/remote
Provides 24x7 support for the client’s Supply Chain business partners and warehouses.
Eyes on glass monitoring from 5 am – 5 pm PST on business working days (Resources will work on an 8 hr shift in this time window on a rotation basis
Outside this window and on weekends it will be On-call support for critical issues, this also on a rotation basis with a team of 4.
Work and triage issues submitted by Supply Chain Businesses, warehouses, and any issues that arise that impact Supply Chain.
Reduce the number of tickets submitted to IT that can be resolved internally to the supply chain and provide quicker resolution time to our partners based on SLAs.
Identify and drive down recurring issues.
Identify process gaps and/or areas of opportunity for industry best practices
Attend RCA calls for SCSS to ensure that the true root cause is identified, and corrective actions are put in place.
Supports device launches.
Work with businesses to get necessary approvals to ensure no impact on key business product launches/promotions
Works with warehouses on tasks required to support outage/maintenance
Provides communications and updates on unplanned outages or issues that are supply chain impacting to ensure that all stakeholders have visibility and awareness of impacts.
Engage in projects to identify areas of opportunity for recons, automation, and monitoring.
Provides insight, feedback, and input to ensure that all of the Supply Chain is covered and upstream and downstream processes are represented.
Engage in Business Validation Testing, Night of Deployment activities, Smoke testing for projects, breakfixes, and enhancements for Supply Chain business.
Engage in Knowledge Transfers with IT to provide support to Supply Chain Businesses, Warehouses, and all partners.
Perform Daily Recons to ensure order flow between customers, warehouses, and other data needed for Supply Chain/Order Processing.
Identify areas/gaps to implement new recons.
Create a document library and documentation for processes, work instructions, and contacts.

OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.


The Opportunity:

We're looking for a strong Master Data Analyst to support the Customer/Partner, Product, Vendor, and Contacts business domains. The role will focus on working alongside our business areas to provide solution support for the Master Data Management (MDM) program functionality. You must have data/master data experience, be used to working in ambiguous/complex programs, and have polished people and senior stakeholder engagement skills.


The Master Data Analyst will be responsible for assessing requirements, and designing and implementing successful Master Data Management solutions that comprise data cleansing, data ingestion pipelines, business process workflow, data matching & de-duplication, and standardization. You will work with a team to create a robust, sustainable, and flexible design and contribute towards technical delivery using a semi-agile delivery framework.




The Master Data Analyst should understand both technical and functional design and bring perspective from process, application, integration, data, technology, and security together into an overall solution design of Master Data Management capabilities.


You Are Great At:

Approach: Responsible for applying MDM strategies, requirements, and policies aligned to the business vision, and leading MDM functional implementation
Requirements: Plan and lead MDM requirement analysis sessions with business users and a thorough understanding of deterministic and probabilistic matching methodologies and master data hierarchy management
High-Level Design: Translate master data requirements into high-level design and oversee the delivery of functional components for master data solutions
Process: Responsible for the rationalization and management of master data across the full lifecycle, and accountable for MDM change processes
Partnership: Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand their environment with its opportunities and challenges to identify and drive fit-for-purpose solutions
MDM Solution: Create enrichment solutions that include logic like validation, match and merge, and survivorship and perform data profiling, data scorecard development, exception management
Program Support: Develop, enhance, and support large-scale end-to-end MDM project implementation
Thought Leadership: Open to expressing and discussing ideas or issues with a range of technical stakeholders – such as leads, architects, and business/technical SMEs to drive best-in-class solutions
Data Quality: Provide guidance on Data Quality analysis on large and complex data sets
Data Governance: Collaborate with Data Governance team to design and build the policies in MDM
Data Transformation: Collaborate with Data Architects to design the data model and develop ETL flows for MDM solutions


What It Takes:

At least 10 years of experience in leading MDM implementations
Well-versed with Data Enrichment (e.g. Dun & Bradstreet)
Completed at least 3 full life cycle experiences in MDM/DG projects using any tools like Informatica
Strong in SQL and experience in Informatica MDM/DG and SAP MDM
Understand and assess sources to target map documents
Experience with business-facing activities such as gathering requirements, facilitating meetings, creating persuasive presentations, and the ability to prepare business-ready deliverables
Understand Governance and data harmonization concepts, practices, and their implementation
Experience of Agile and traditional SDLC delivery methodologies
Work independently, efficiently, and effectively under tight timelines to deliver results by critical deadlines
Experience with high-level designs and overseeing the delivery of functional components for master data solutions
Excellent business communication skills and a collaborative approach
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

This job is expected to pay in the range of $102,000 to $130,000 USD in addition to a comprehensive and competitive group benefit and healthcare plan. Individual compensation will be determined based on skills and experience comparable to the job requirements.

The Role : Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools

The Team :
The Agile & PPM Tools team is responsible for developing and managing enterprise tools enabling Agile Execution (Azure DevOps), Project Portfolio Management (Solution Business Manager) and Reporting (Tableau), for all the S&P Global Divisions. These tools are used across S&P for Portfolio Management capabilities like prioritizing, executing and tracking Portfolios, Agile Workflow Execution to enable Agile delivery and Portfolio & Agile Analytics.

The Impact :
Are you looking for an opportunity to advance your career as an innovative enterprise team member? The Agile & PPM Tools Team is looking for an innovative professional who can bring teamwork, creativity, and business analyst experience to a global team.

What’s in it for you :
As a Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior stakeholders from all the divisions and showcase your ability to tackle multiple assignments with ease and gracefully absorb changes as they present themselves. Overall goal of the Team is to develop and support a common Enterprise toolset for all divisions to enable Portfolio Management, resourcing, execution, and reporting with cutting edge technologies like Azure DevOps, AWS Cloud Systems (S3, EC2, RDS etc), AWS Services (Lambda, Glue, S3, Redshift etc), Databricks as well as Market leaders in PPM and Agile tools.

Responsibilities :
In the day-to-day operations, you will be a part of the Agile & PPM Tools Scrum team and will support our internal customers which include users from across the S&P Global Enterprise at all levels from senior leadership to individual users. You will also facilitate communication between our users and our Business and Scrum team members who manage and deliver solutions on these platforms. With your acute investigation, troubleshooting and communication skills, you will be championing support best practices and improving our user’s experience. Some of your areas of ownership will include:

Agile & PPM Tools Engineering Team (Scrum Team):
Support our customers on the requests raised by them on our ticketing platform - Service Now
Troubleshoot and service customer requests focusing on maximum customer satisfaction
Liaison with end customer to Support and advance tools adoption.
Share knowledge with peers and foster a cohesive self-organized team environment
Provide feedback to help the Business and Development teams to create high-value products
Escalates and tracks issues with appropriate levels within the team
Build a deep understanding of the solutions delivered on both platforms to understand utility from our users/customers perspective
Keep up to date on support and customer experience best practices and suggest or implement improvements in processes or tools

What We’re Looking For :
Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology, Engineering or related area
0-3 years of relevant work experience with Web based Applications
Proven willingness to learn, a positive attitude, and an ability to work in a fast-paced, high demand work environment
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal and the ability to investigate and summarize technical concepts clearly and succinctly
Highly organized, independent and multitasker
Good data analysis skills using Excel and any other BI tools
Knowledge of Agile Execution tools like Azure DevOps, JIRA etc.
Experience using any Workflow Management tool like ServiceNow, Solutions Business Manager, VersionOne, etc.
Demonstrable experience in facilitating, leading, influencing, and managing within large-scale matrix, globally distributed organizations
Open to working flexible hours as per business needs

Preferred Qualifications :
SAFe or Agile Certification
Prior experience managing a low code platform
Experience with AWS Systems and Services
Experience on PPM tools like Solutions Business Manager (Micro Focus Tool) and/or Agile
Execution tools like Azure DevOps (Microsoft tool)

Job Grade : 8

The Location : Dallas, TX

Job Description:

Strategically responsible for providing a holistic view of risks across key enterprise functions and identifying high compliance risks across the enterprise; transforming data into actionable information and plans; improving timeliness of identifying higher risk actions within the enterprise; providing uniform methodology for visualizing risks; engaging key functional areas within the entities to prioritize risk areas of focus; and, providing increased monitoring capabilities regarding issue recurrence and issue mitigation and remediation effectiveness.

Tactically responsible for the following processes: compliance dashboards and other reporting mechanisms throughout the enterprise; compliance data mining, including identifying trends and potential risks using various data modeling and machine learning methodologies; as well as compliance audit standardization.

Required:

Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent work experience (preferred areas: Business, Computer Science, Economics, Healthcare Administration, Health Information Management, Data Analytics/Science, Mathematics or Statistics).
3-5 years of experience in data science/management, validation, and analysis.
Intermediate to advanced programming/querying proficiency in SQL and Python.
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization and analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and MicroStrategy.
Skilled in effective report/dashboard development.
Ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.

Preferred:

3-5 years of experience in healthcare industry.
Intermediate knowledge of Healthcare Compliance oversight and monitoring concepts.
Intermediate to advanced Programming/querying skills in SQL, R, SAS, Python, etc.
Familiarity with cloud and enterprise data warehouse tools such as Big Query, Azure SQL, SSMS,
Familiarity with enterprise ETL processes.
Knowledge of any Governance, Risk, & Compliance (GRC) program.

Senior Financial Analyst - Wholesale

When you’re in the business of making connections, diversity and inclusion become part of your fiber. We believe in unlocking the power of diversity to drive digital connectivity, so if you feel your experience looks a little different, and you can add value, we encourage you to apply! #BuildGigabitAmerica

About Us

Frontier is a leading communications provider offering gigabit speeds to empower and connect millions of consumers and businesses in 25 states. It is building critical digital infrastructure across the country with its fiber-optic network and cloud-based solutions, enabling connections today and future-proofing for tomorrow. Rallied around its purpose of Building Gigabit America™, the company is focused on supporting a digital society, closing the digital divide, and working toward a more sustainable environment. Frontier is preparing today for a better tomorrow. Visit www.frontier.com.

About The Role

The Senior Financial Analyst will work to build financial plans/forecasts, and present complex financial analyses for segment leads, Executive leadership, and other company executives as they relate to the Wholesale organization. This role will work closely with the Director of Finance to train and develop the team, as well as create and implement processes to enhance analytical capabilities.

Responsibilities

Analyze complex financial data to identify areas of risk, inefficiency, and opportunity for various business units and diverse project portfolios across the organization
Present and analyze data to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to segment and FP&A leadership for decision-making purposes
Interpret financial results and drive continuous efforts to identify and implement activities that reduce costs or improve profitability
Assist the Director of Finance to improve company performance by evaluating processes, monitoring indicators, highlighting trends, and analyzing causes of unexpected variances
Act as a peer resource to other team members, assisting with company knowledge transfer and training on analytical tools and methods
Create, manage, and review PowerPoint presentations as required
Compare Plans vs. Actuals to ensure data is in alignment with business objectives
Establish and maintain financial and operational KPIs and executive dashboards
Ensure effective understanding, analysis, and reporting of key metrics such as price, costs, volume, and headcount-related activities
Work cross-departmentally to assimilate accurate, complete, and effective reporting
Stay abreast of the latest trends, tools, and technologies within the industry
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications

3-5 years of professional experience as a Financial Analyst, heavily focused on financial planning, strategy, and engagement with commercial teams
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or other related fields
Strong desire to lead, mentor, and develop teams
Experience forecasting revenues, and costs, developing budgets, analyzing pricing structures, identifying variances, and providing root-cause
Experience leveraging complex financial modeling with Excel; experience with Adaptive Insights as a financial planning tool is a plus
Experience working with data mining/reporting tools, such as SQL and Power BI is a plus
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain analytical findings clearly and succinctly to a wide range of audiences
Must possess strong intellectual curiosity and problem-solving capabilities
Creative mindset with the ability to convey new ideas to both non-finance and finance audiences
Highly self-motivated; a self-starter



Salary Range $52,000 - $148,000

Frontier salaries are estimated by third parties and may or may not reflect actual or total compensation. Please confirm with your recruiter.

We are deeply committed to attracting talented team members in the US from all backgrounds regardless of race, age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability status, or nationality.
